channel.title: Allegedly with Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
channel.description: Two totally opposite friends – comedian Theo Von and filmmaker/journalist Matt Cole Weiss -- compete to see who has better “alleged" tales of celebrities, hilarity, trauma, dating, success and failure from their years living in Hollywood. Points will be given, winners will be chosen and careers will be altered forever…allegedly.

item.title: Robert Patrick
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: The terminator killer has come! CBS’s Scorpion star Robert Patrick has rolled his way on to the Allegedly Podcast explaining his “rat” truck, how he got the nickname “ripper” and how he found out that Elon Musk is a big time Terminator fan! Also Matt and Theo share a newly created song, tales of touring Guantanamo Bay and whether or not Matt is a Rams fan…the animal or sports team? IDK! FIND OUT WHO WINS! LISTEN, RATE, REVIEW!

item.title: Jim Sturgess
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: The “Pale Skin Detroit Voldemort” star of Hard Sun on Hulu, Jim Sturgess has crossed the pond and landed at Allegedly! This British lad breaks down the Hard Sun plot of pre-apocalyptic mayhem and how that would work in the real world…would you selfie the destruction of earth? Also Jim talks about his first acting gig, which one of his infamous sex scenes got awkward and why the biggest stars are usually the nicest. Also Matt asks (a lot) about Theo James and Theo Von wonders where that conversation is heading...jail? FIND OUT WHO WINS! LISTEN, RATE, REVIEW!

item.title: Jon Huertas
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss

Also Theo and Matt settle an old debate on who has the better knock knock joke and how puberty can affect us all in very different ways! FIND OUT WHO WINS! LISTEN, RATE, REVIEW!

item.title: Bruce Campbell
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: Shut up and do your work! A true throwback has arrived at Allegedly! Horror legend Bruce Campbell dawning a grey suit and pocket square tells it like it is…or should be. This chainsaw cutting leading man brings his unshakeable confidence and film making experience to Allegedly, talking Ash vs Evil Dead, Burn Notice, signing tits and what exactly makes a Hawaiian shirt worth wearing! Matt and Theo hold on as Bruce spills on the unconventional life of a dying breed, old Hollywood has returned for the night! FIND OUT WHO WINS! LISTEN, RATE, REVIEW!

item.title: Summer Bishil
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: She isn’t a witty eyepatch wielding magician but she plays one on TV! The beautiful Summer Bishil has appeared from a cloud of smoke and into the Allegedly Podcast! Also Theo tells of a hometown glitter scam and Matt talks of killing Harry Potter and so much more! FIND OUT WHO WINS! LISTEN, RATE, REVIEW!

item.title: Jamie Lee
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: Jamie Lee is Crashing all over! The new HBO star crashes the Comedy Store Studio with tales from the back alleys of all things comedy. Matt and Theo dive into her book “Weddiculous” which of course spirals into the best fitting gender for Matt’s soon to be adopted child. Jamie also discusses how she and Theo meet, life in a comedy writers room and the nervous wait when Artie Lang uses the bathroom. FIND OUT WHO WINS! LISTEN, RATE, REVIEW!

item.title: Best Of 2017
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: The 2017 best of the best from Allegedly has come! This gift to our fans is a compilation of the best interviews from 2017! Matt and Theo discuss some of their favorites moments, including Gus Kenworthy, Colton Underwood, Spencer Pratt, Gilbert Gottfried and much more! Also the guys talk about some of their least favorite moments and a top 10 list with TWO different favorite guests of the year! Tune in to find out who!

item.title: Gilbert Gottfried
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: One of the all time greats Gilbert Gottfried has come to Allegedly with his infamous voice talking about his new documentary entitled Gilbert a Gilbert Gottfried Story, which we learn about the “man behind the curtain”, the worries about his family being on camera and how incredibly careful he is with money. Also Gilbert breaks down his appearance on The Apprentice, old Hollywood and the obvious yet unspoken actions of “horny producers”. Mr. Gottfried sets up an hilarious story of getting beat out by Dustin Hoffman for a acting gig and why he had to pay to see Aladdin!? Everybody wins in this episode, Gilbert doesn’t stop crackin’ up the place and Matt and Theo enjoy the ride! LISTEN, RATE, REVIEW!

item.title: Spencer Pratt
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: He’s everyone’s favorite villain; “The Hills” star Spencer Pratt joins “Allegedly” and NO IS OFF LIMITS! Spencer discusses everything from his time on “The Hills” and on-going feuds, being best friends with Brody Jenner and their relationship with Caitlyn Jenner, hanging out with Ryan Gosling in a USC dorm room, how he missed the opportunity to work for Donald Trump and of course his love for hummingbirds and crystals. Theo and Matt for the first time use their “yellow cards” to silence anyone for 30 seconds and things get heated! Find out how!

item.title: "Hollywood Medium" Tyler Henry
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: He's the psychic to the stars, "Hollywood Medium" star Tyler Henry, and while Theo is out of town, he comes into "Allegedly" to spill some psychic dirt to Matt and co-host Dax Holt of "TMZ", "Access Hollywood", and "Live with Kelly". AND SHIT GETS REAL when he talks meeting the ghost of Biggie Smalls, that time he felt one of his clients was going to kill his wife, and of course - THE KARDASHIANS! The hosts eventually get to the question on everyone's minds... not "does he make this stuff up?" (though the question was asked), but more importantly "do ghosts watch us bang?!". Find out now!

AND SHIT GETS REAL when he talks meeting the ghost of Biggie Smalls, that time he felt one of his clients was going to kill his wife, and of course - THE KARDASHIANS! The hosts eventually get to the question on everyone's minds... not "does he make this stuff up?" (though the question was asked), but more importantly "do ghosts watch us bang?!". Find out now!

item.title: Gus Kenworthy & Colton Underwood
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: Dreams do come true - for Matt at least. "Allegedly" goes for the gold with Olympic skiing medalist, ESPN Body Issue model and star of MTV's "The Challenge" (as well as Matt's dreams) - Gus Kenworthy! The out and proud (but taken... or is he?) stud, along with guest co-host Josh Peck, and football's (and formerly Aly Raisman's) Colton Underwood proves too much for Matt who literally has to tap out due to the hunk overload. Kenworthy opens up to the boys about his relationship, making out with Miley Cyrus, banging in the Olympic village, and refusing to go to the White House. Though the competition between Matt and Josh heats up in the last sports themed round, the real question becomes - will Matt get Kenworthy's number? What do you think?

item.title: Cassie Scerbo
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: In 3 weeks, "Sharknado 5: Global Swarming" arrives, and Nova Clarke herself, Cassie Scerbo, is in the studio doing her first interview about the new installment in the franchise! Find out the movie's twist (there's a SHARKZILLA) and cameos (FABIO as the POPE?), how the hell she acts with flying sharks, and what "Sharknado" fans are really like. But the big question - would Scerbo ever mate with a part man, part shark creature? And did you know sharks have two penises? Take the "Shark Week" vs. "Sharknado Week" along with Cassie, and hear the hosts deliver two cheers in homage to her "Bring It On Role". But who's gonna take home the spirit stick?

item.title: Charlie Weber
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: Happy 4th of July! Due to the holiday, we decided to release this one the day after so you can enjoy it in whatever hungover state you're in. Charlie Weber, star of the hit show "How To Get Away With Murder" and the new film "Ex-Patriot" (currently out now), joins host Matt and special guest co-host the always hilarious "Superstore" star Lauren Ash (as Theo was away for an amazing charity event). Weber talks about playing a CIA agent in this Trump era environment... touching Viola Davis's awards... the up-coming season of "HTGAWM"... and for the first time, the new love in his life, "Murder" co-star Liza Weil. Lauren and Matt duke it out hardcore for the win, but once Matt discovers Weber was an Abercrombie and Fitch model, all bets are off.

item.title: Josh Peck
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: Newlywed Josh Peck - that chubby kid from Nickelodeon's "Drake & Josh" who turned out to be a hottie boombottie - stopped by the studio days before his big wedding to talk to the boys about the big day, the new wifey, and the plans for the future! But if you think the hosts let it stop there, you don't know "Allegedly"! They got Peck to spill the beans on how he lost his VIRGINITY, his wild years of partying and drinking, how Nickelodeon got him his school "degree", what he thinks of former co-stars Amanda Bynes and Drake Bell, and most importantly, what it's like having John Stamos's phone number (better then you ever dreamed). LISTEN! LIKE! RATE! REVIEW! ENJOY!

item.title: Jim O' Heir
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: He is a killer? I mean a comic. I mean an actor. I mean, he may be all three. From 'Parks and Rec' and his new movie ‘Middle Man’ (and just about every other show imaginable) its the one and only John O’Heir. John dishes on coming up through the acting ranks, which tv show was the worst to work on, and what it was like to get really really close to Chris Pratt. With Matt Weiss in Africa, comedian guest host Ari Mannis fills in perfectly, as John’s role in Middle Man is a comedian who picks up a hitch hiking manager on his way to vegas and gets alot more than the new career he is aiming for. Listen and then go see the film!

item.title: Al Madrigal
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary:
Al Madrigal, takes us behind the scenes of Jim Carrey's new hit Showtime series "Im Dying Up Here". Al talks about comedy in the 70's, what its like working with Carrey, and why this new dark comedy is exactly what comedy needed.
"Im Dying Up Here" (Sundays, 10pm EST, Showtime)
Set in the celebrated and infamous L.A. stand-up comedy scene of the '70s, where the careers of most comedy superstars began, "I'm Dying Up Here" delves into the inspired and damaged psyches that inhabit the hilarious, but complex business of making an audience laugh. The series is based on William Knoedelseder's book of the same name.

item.title: John Brenkus
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary:
John Brenkus has spent the last decade studying and popularizing the unique characteristics of the world's greatest athletes. He produced the Emmy Award-winning program Sport Science on ESPN, which has helped millions of viewers understand the "Why" behind the "Wow" of their favorite athletes and sports moments. He also created the groundbreaking series Fight Science for National Geographic, and has his new weekly podcast "Brink of Midnight" (available everywhere now) where he interviews athletes and entertainers to find the specific moments of their journeys that changed their lives.
Matt Weiss is in Africa so Theo Von cohosts with Ari Mannis. Wow the cat is away the mice will play... with John Brenkus. Enjoy!

item.title: Dule Hill & Elise Neal
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: While the cat's away, the divas will play! "Logan" star Elise Neal steps in for Theo who is out and about making people laugh across the country, and she and Matt interview the star of the new movie "Sleight" (and soon to be seen on "Suits") - Dule Hill! From the producers of "Get Out" comes this movie about magic and mayhem, and Hill fills us in on making the film, getting engaged, and possibly meeting Prince Harry! Neal talks about breaking the internet with her hot 51-year-old bod, what kind of a man she's looking for, and even sings us some "Hustle and Flow". The competition gets out of control when each person is out for themselves, including Matt, to take it all down! You know it's hard out there for a pimp...

Chandrasekhar is also the author of the new book "Mustache Shenanigans" all about his journey in Hollywood, including fighting with Burt Reynolds, smoking with Willie Nelson, and being on drugs while selling a movie at Sundance. item.title: The Dudesons
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: They're the Finnish stunt group that has dominated YOUTUBE with stunts like putting a scorpion in their mouths and duct taping them shut... letting alligators bite their arms... and just about every other crazy thing you can think of. Part Roman Atwood, part "Jackass", part positive anarchists, The Dudesons have ruled MTV, their own film, and their top stunts on Youtube and Facebook. Jukka Hilden, head of the group, joins "Allegedly" with mousetraps and rubber bands to see how far the hosts will go to win. Who wants it the most - Theo or Matt? It comes down to the Dudeson Wheel of Fortune.

item.title: Orny Adams
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: You may recognize him as Coach Bobby Finstock on MTV's hit show "Teen Wolf" or from that documentary he was featured in with Jerry Seinfeld "Comedian" or from his many, many talk show appearances and comedy specials... it's the one and only Orny Adams. Part Richard Lewis, part Gilbert Godfried, part Carol Channing, this stand-up comedian doesn't do many interview, but opened up to us about the documentary that killed his career, about the "Teen Wolf" upcoming series finale (and if he's seen Colton Haynes naked), and about the lowest and highest points of his life. But will it be Theo's story about accidental ejaculation or Matt's secret connection with Orny that put one of the hosts in the winner's circle? Listen up!

item.title: Phil Keoghan
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: We've got "The Amazing Race" host Phil Keoghan on, and we ask him the question everyone wants to know - as someone who's been around the world, which country is his favorite to masturbate in? (No, seriously, we asked). As season 29 of the hit reality show premieres this week, we grilled Keoghan on the new season twists, on getting mistaken for Jeff Probst, on his least favorite place in the world, on how he prevents chafing on his balls, and all the things "Amazing Race" groupies have done to get his attention. In the end, will it be Theo's rendition of "Amazing Grace" or Matt's pitching of himself to be on Season 30 that will win Keoghan over?

item.title: Sophie Simmons
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: She started being featured on TV at the age of 11 on "Gene Simmons Family Jewels", but now Sophie Simmons has come into her own... singer, songwriter, actress, model and women's advocate! And the apple doesn't fall too far from the tree - at least when it comes to in your face honesty! Simmons spills all sorts of T on the podcast, calling out people like Katey Sagal, Britney Spears, and the Kardashians on their bad behavior, as well as discussing dating in Hollywood (she's single, sort of), the casting couch (she keeps screenshots, people), and what it's like being Gene and Shannon's daughter. Which host do you think she takes a shine to more?

Simmons spills all sorts of T on the podcast, calling out people like Katey Sagal, Britney Spears, and the Kardashians on their bad behavior, as well as discussing dating in Hollywood (she's single, sort of), the casting couch (she keeps screenshots, people), and what it's like being Gene and Shannon's daughter. Which host do you think she takes a shine to more?

item.title: John Henson

item.itunes:summary: The 90's are calling and former "Talk Soup" host John Henson is answering. Memba Skunk Boy, the OG Talk Souper turned "Wipeout" host? He's here with your boys to talk about the strippers he banged back in the day, his run in with Tom (and Suri) Cruise, and the size of his young son's penis. No, really. In the end, a fatal food mistake kills one host's chances, but everybody leaves a winner this time! Not really.

item.title: Bitsie Tulloch
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: As the series finale of the hit NBC show "Grimm" looms, one of the show's leads for all six seasons, Bitsie Tulloch, is in the "Allegedly" studio to talk about the end of an era and the beginning of a new one, namely her upcoming marriage to co-star David Giuntoli (a "Road Rules" veteran just like Theo). Find out if they've ever banged on set (and where)... what the network thought of their relationship... and when they will finally walk down the aisle. Tulloch, a Harvard graduate, may have to lower her intellect just a bit to judge the competition that is Theo versus Matt, and in the end it all comes down to one single song.

item.title: Tim Matheson
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: Tim Matheson is in the house with some real animals now! Matheson, who played Otter in the classic "Animal House" and currently plays Ronald Reagan in the National Geographic flick "Killing Reagan" sat down with the hosts to discuss his long career working with greats like John Belushi, Lucille Ball, Michael Landon, Chris Farley, Chevy Chase, and so many more. Matheson let years of cinematic history spill - including roles he turned down, people he's feuded with and some good old fashioned tales of Hollywood sex, drugs, rock and roll. From Nancy Reagan's reputation to casting couches to the plot of the new "Jumanji", film, Matheson holds nothing back in this interview which has points flying all over the place, leaving the win decision down to the very end.

item.title: Aaron Carter
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: He's back! Remember child star, singer, actor Aaron Carter? He may have disappeared from the public eye for a beat, but he was only working on his craft, coming back stronger than ever with his new album LOVE. Live the ups and downs of being a celebrity at such a young age, to traveling the world, to hitting rock bottom, to bouncing back with a vengeance. Carter updates everyone on his love life (he's ready for marriage and kids), his competition (look out Justin Bieber), his relationship with brother Backstreet Boy Nick Carter (it's getting back to normal), and even how his mother once sold his hair on Ebay. Using demerits instead of points, Carter takes charge of the competition, making both hosts work their asses off to pull in a win.

Find out which writers are too big for their own britches (not you Judy Blume)... which Kardashian he'd never write a book about... and what the award winning "Justice League" writer thinks about the upcoming movie version of the iconic comic. It's our most intellectual "Allegedly" yet, but but let's be serious, he just hires children in Nicaragua to write his novels these days (no seriously, he said it...).

item.title: Stassi Schroeder

item.itunes:summary: Jennifer Lawrence just named her as her celebrity crush. She's been in the news recently after a very controversial episode of "Vanderpump Rules". Schroeder came in to clear up her recent "mental breakdown" tweets and why she's pissed at the show... to discuss Jennifer Lawrence's crush (although she doesn't pick Lawrence as her own celebrity crush)... to clear up rumors of her dating life... and to give all the T on Lisa (do Lisa and Ken really bang), Katie (and her box eating), Scheana (and her divorce), Jax (huge mistake she admits), and the rest. To top if off, you'll exclusively find out which celebrity tried to pick her up on a dating app with one word - "hey". Though he didn't win her heart, one of the hosts sure does with a surprise win in the end.

item.itunes:summary: She was Jan on "The Office"... Tammy on "Transparent"... and starred on pretty much every show ever aired since 1976 from "Little House on the Prairie" to "Murder She Wrote". But none of that compares to her amazing performance on... "Allegedly". Find out what it really feels like to lose at the Emmy's... which young famous actor she worked with and wanted to bang... and what it was like to ALMOST star in "Back to the Future". With a Broadway show tune competition in round 3, the pressure is on... Melora... to pick which voice was the best of the worst.

item.title: Courtney Stodden

The bosomed beaut talks all about her crazy marriage to "The Green Mile" star Doug Hutchison, including their recent miscarriage, their enormous age difference, and the problems that face their relationship. Find out what celebrity she hates, what celebrity she wants to bang, and why the hell she carries a sippy cup with her wherever she goes. But judge not lest thou be judged, as the hosts face Stodden who will ultimately pick the winner of the day.

item.title: Abby Lee Miller
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: Love her or hate her, "Dance Moms" star Abby Lee Miller knows how to create amazing dancers... and endless controversy. In her first sit down interview since pleading guilty to bankruptcy fraud, the self-proclaimed Pittsburgh podunk Lifetime star brings her judging skills to "Allegedly" to pick a winner between Matt and guest host "Big Brother" all star Dr. Will Kirby. In between scoring, Miller opens up about her fears to go to prison... how things went wrong for her financially... who she's hooking up with these days... and how she can make a kid cry in 30 seconds flat. Hear the Dance Mom coach take responsibility for her actions in a candid way, proving that none of us are perfect.

item.title: Brian "Head" Welch
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: Things get powerful when Brian "Head" Welch, guitarist from the mega-huge band KoRn, stops in to discuss his new book "With Eyes Wide Open", his gut wrenching tale of drugs, family, faith, and forgiveness that led him to leave the band then rejoin it in 2013. You can't get any more candid or honest than Welch as he discusses hitting rock bottom, giving up a kid for adoption, tracking eight balls on FedEx and being joyful that he's even alive. But it's not all serious, the laughter comes in waves, especially with tales of vomit and dead skunks and a gospel sing off.

item.title: Ta'Rhonda Jones
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: Needing your "Empire" fix after last week's finale? Well, Porsha herself, Ta'Rhonda Jones, is in the studio to talk all about that climactic pregnant woman falling to her possible death finale and what it's really like to be on a huge hit like this. Jones also opens up a lot about her past - including her brother's death, her time working at a nursing home (and the old dudes who groped her), and her failed engagement. But none of that compares to the kick she gets out of playing judge between the hosts which ends in an epic freestyle rap battle for the ages.

item.itunes:summary: The sexy, salacious (and non-stuffing) Maksim Chmerkovskiy is our guest this week - and he's holding nothing back! Chmerkovskiy fills us in on which contestant he slept with... which contestant he hated with all his being... and most importantly, he addresses that existential question of what to do if you get a boner while dancing. Hear the hosts regale with tales of film festival plumbing problems and funeral parlor tricks with The Miz, forcing Chmerkovskiy to make a game-changing decision.

item.title: Franka Potente
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: Our first foreigner joins der show! German actress Franka Potente (who you know from "Run Lola Run", "Blow", and "The Bourne Identity") gets to play PREISRICHERTIN (that's German for "judge", thanks Google) on this special international episode of "Allegedly". Frau Potente blows the lid off of life in Hollywood, dropping bombshells like it's World War II. Did you know Lola was a smoker? That she didn't speak to Johnny Depp during filming of "Blow"? And worst of all - that she may be retiring from acting?! All that, plus stories of Christmas hams, Carvel cakes, oral sex, and the anti-Christ (Kris Jenner that is) on this awesomely cinematic episode.

item.title: Mena Suvari
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: The sexy Mena Suvari, star of the "American" Trifecta ("Pie", "Beauty" and "Horror Story" that is) drops in to the studio to judge some stories about Glenn Close's bad-ass posse and John Larroquette munching on candy canes. Find out the path that led Suvari from a toothless kid model to Rice-A-Roni commercials to the star of one of the best films of all time ("American Beauty" of course) and hear Suvari ACTUALLY recreate her lines from an infamous episode of "Boy Meets World". We'll also get the answer to a very important question - who's a better kisser - Kevin Spacey or Chris Klein? Only on "Allegedly"

item.title: Jason Ritter
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: Attention all of you crazy “Parenthood” fans – Jason Ritter is in the building! Yes, the actor drops in and talks all about that show, as well as what it’s like growing up in Hollywood as the son of the legendary John Ritter. Other topics of discussion including awkward interview questions (like the time Jason got asked how his father was… after he’d passed away), bad auditions (like the time Jason blew his “Spiderman” chances) and of course, PORN! To top it off, Ritter hears the hosts tell tales of Courtney Love and Sunset Strip make-out sessions, and ultimately decides who the victor shall be!

item.title: Luenell
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: The one and the only Luenell is in the studio, folks! The "Borat" and "Hotel Transylvania" star discusses all the perks of a being a female comedian in Hollywood, like having groupies ("I screw them and everything") and working with Liam Neeson ("He's super handsome. He could of gotten it had he asked for it"). Listen as Luenell and the "Allegedly" crew unabashedly swap embarrassing stories about Denzel Washington, Jim Carrey, taking dumps on movie sets, and exploding Cinnabons. But in the end, not only does Luenell pick a episode winner, but she has the honor of overseeing a whole new segment - The Debate!

item.title: Max Hodges
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: Want to know what happens to people after TMZ? Look no further. The Jeff Spicoli-looking former face of the show, Max Hodges, rolls out of bed and drops in to reveal some wild stories about partying in Hollywood, rubbing elbows with the likes of Warren G and Matthew McConaughey, and living life one beer can at a time after working for the entertainment conglomerate. How this man's liver is still functioning, we have no idea! Join Max as he hears the hosts' awkward tales about meeting Oprah and Brad Pitt and has to decide who's is more embarrassing.

item.title: Zachery Ty Bryan
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary:
Zachery Ty Bryan - Brad from the classic sitcom "Home Improvement" - drops a HUGE Oedipal bomb! On a show that starred Pamela Anderson, turns out dude had quite a thing for his TV mom. All this plus more BTS stories about Wilson's smoke filled dressing room, the Burger King that Tim Allen sold drugs at and whatever happened to J.T.T.
Meanwhile, poor Z.T.B. gets subjected to stories about Hepatitis scares and ungodly flatulence in the presence of "Dances with Wolves" star Mary McDonnell. Who will win this episode? Place your bets.

item.title: Cheri Oteri
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: Collette Reardon. Barbara Walters. Arianna the Spartan Cheerleader. Cheri Oteri has played many memorable roles on "Saturday Night Live" over the years. But today, she takes on her biggest one yet - PODCAST JUDGE! That's right, the actress fills the hot seat in this week's episode of "Allegedly with Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss" where she must choose between two sick hosts who's stories involving Justin Timberlake, Tim Robbins, a porn star, a dildo, and a little Vietnamese boy. But before she picks, Oteri gets grilled about her favorite "SNL" moment ever... her thoughts on Donald Trump... why she'll never do a reality show... and that time someone asked her to do a cheer in the gynecologist's office.

item.title: Jeff Timmons
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: The game is on when 98 Degrees band member Jeff Timmons stops by the podcast to judge which host has sunk lower - the one who stole cupcakes from Neil Patrick Harris's birthday party or the one who didn't recognize Wayne Gretzky and asked him to take a picture of himself with someone else? Timmons also divulges some of his own tales from his many years in La-La Land including what it was like having lady boy groupies in Thailand, that time he got catfished, and the famous actress who tried to woo him by putting on her own movies while they made out. Only in Hollywood folks.

item.title: Drew Lynch
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: "America's Got Talent" finalist comic Drew Lynch fills the celebrity judge chair on this episode of "Allegedy with Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss". After winning over the hearts of America, the speech-impaired comedian earned a free pass straight to the finals of the competition where he plans on battling it out to the end this month. But before that, he had to come by the podcast to talk about the "AGT" judges and become a judge himself to some of the most embarrassing Hollywood stories you ever heard (hint: someone pretended they had Parkinson's disease to impress a famous actor).

item.title: Bruce Vilanch
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: The man, the myth, the T-shirts. Legendary writer, comedian, and multiple Emmy Award winner Bruce Vilanch stops by to judge the "Allegedly" podcast. Sure, he's written for the Academy Awards, starred on Broadway, been immortalized on "The Simpsons", but he's never been subjected to the torture that is Matt and Theo. Vilanch spills the dirt on the celebrities who are mad at him, the myth of the "closeted" celebrity, and what Bill Cosby is really like. In the end, Vilanch has to consider stories involving Scott Baio and Jerry Mathers to ultimately decide who wins the episode.

item.title: Riley Smith
item.itunes:author: Theo Von & Matthew Cole Weiss
item.itunes:summary: He may play Rachel McAdams's boy toy on True Detective, but Hollywood stud Riley Smith is the one to get interrogated in this premiere episode of Allegedly with Theo Von and Matthew Cole Weiss. The never aging star talks getting high with Woody Harrelson, the famous actress who tried to get his number, and what it's like to be eskimo brothers with one of the hosts (you'll never guess which one). In the end, Smith has to pick which host won the podcast, though with embarrassing stories involving Kirk Douglas and Ice Cube, he sure has his work cut out for him.
